name: Grand Oasis Cancun

reviews.text: I read mixed reviews about this hotel and I had a doubt about this hotel when I booked it. I don't have any complaints about this hotel. The service was good, we stayed at the Grand Oasis so that was a big plus for all the options it covered. The only thing is that the lobby is so hot you would have to go to the VIP lounge to cool off but other than that everything is great. We got and ocean front room in the pyramid it was very nice. There are 17 restaurants to choose from and a wide variety of food. The food was excellent. For an all inclusive hotel the food, service and landscape is awesome. The beach is wonderful there was always plenty of chairs available and was always kept clean. The hotel is very clean, the staff are very helpful and try their best to please you. The hotel is situated very close to all the attractions and very close to the airport. We plan on returning back to this hotel next summer. We had an awesome vacation in Cancun!!! Thank you Grand Oasis.
reviews.title: Great All Inclusive Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 8 nights at this hotel, and the time stayed couldn't have been better. Was my 4th time in Cancun, and this hotel was the best I have been too.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort, and wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check-in was reasonably swift, and the majority of the receptionists spoke good English. As a party of 8, we had 4 twin rooms. Rooms were not adjacent, but 3 were within a few rooms of another, whilst the 4th was two floors above, but all were in the same block. The room was as expected - two queen size beds, smallish balcony and a bathroom. Also was a 42inch flatscreen TV with 40 channels or so. The minibar was free, barring you didn't go over the permitted 2 drinks per day of water, sprite, coke or sol. Beds were comfy, and the bathroom came with two sinks - and was more than adequate. The air con worked well too, although in one of the rooms in the party, it was not great, but they were not overly fussed.
reviews.title: My Cancun Holiday 2012

reviews.text: The maid (we think) seemed to come later in the day, but we put this down to us being the kind to sleep in till quite late. The only 'annoying' things about the room was that we were woken (albeit at 10am) by someone requesting if we had mosquitos or anything in the room, which we did not. At least it shows they were willing to check.
reviews.title: Definitely Not A Family Resort - College Students Only

reviews.text: The Grand Oasis Cancun shares the same complex with Oasis Cancun, and all guests are able to walk around the entire complex, use the same pools and so on. The complex is rather big, and we were a bit daunted at first, but you soon get used to it. I must admit, at first, I was a little perplexed as to the difference between staying (and paying more) and the Grand Oasis than just the Oasis Cancun. The difference is actually quite considerable upon staying there. As a Grand Oasis resident you get full access to every bar and every restaurant, whilst also free room service (i was led to believe) and also we were allowed into the foam party for free (i think it was 390pesos otherwise.) Simply put - the restaurants alone make it worthwhile. Whereas Oasis Cancun residents have an extra surcharge on the specialist residents, of $20 per head, these were all free. The Tapas restaurant was beautiful, and never busy, with service which was on the whole immaculate. There were around 14 different dishes to try, all of which were brought out as you progressed, and the house red was very nice.
reviews.title: Totally underrated, I loved it.

reviews.text: Room Air Conditioning was broke upon check-in - no legitimate attempt to fix by maintainence no concern by hotel. Several other items in room (i.e. handles and locks on sliders) broke or missing. Curtains had black colored mold on back of them, cleaning staff was inconsistant and unreliable. Although we expect bugs in this region we do not expect ants crawling on the walls along with roaches and other bugs. Bathroom water pressure was very Poor and would only get either hot or cold water and unable to mix adequately. Three of 18 restaurants air conditioned but not effective others were unbearable. Hot food was luke warm, cold food was luke warm. Quality of food with exception of 2 food places was extremely poor. Front desk staff & managers were of no help. Hotel overbooked and staff not helpful. I will never go back to Cancun because of my experience with this Hotel . My son came home with a skin infection which we believe is from the unsanitary swimming pool.
reviews.title: Wanted to leave by 2nd day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel July 8th thru 12th of this year. Overall, we had a positive experience at this hotel. Check in was very smooth. We arrived very early, 10 am, due to a last minute change in our flight itinerary, but were able to get bracelets to be able to enjoy the hotel until our room was ready.
reviews.title: Good All Inclusive hotel for the price, but not without minor issues

reviews.text: The room was very large. We had an oceanfront room in the building on the Grand Oasis side. No problem with noise or spring breakers. I liked that the property was divided into 5 buildings, it was convenient to run back to the room quick if we forgot something. We also were behind the pool where we spent most of our time.
reviews.title: NICE ON THE OUTSIDE

reviews.text: We choose this hotel because of the variety of restaurants available. Unfortunately, we did not get to eat at many. I was frustrated that almost all the restaurants did not allow bathing suits and/or wet clothes. Since we spent all day at the pool or beach, our only food option was the snack bar, which served hot dogs, burgers and fries. This got very old after 4 days.
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The deli sports bar on the Oasis side let us in during the day, but the food was pretty disappointing. I ordered the buffalo wings, and was given 4 little tiny wings, that did not resemble the picture at all, and did not have dressing or celery as described.
reviews.title: 3rd and last time in Cancun.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will start off by saying that no amount of money savings over another hotel will get me to stay there again.
reviews.title: What a terrible experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check In: The check in could have been the worst part of all. We arrived at about 4pm, there were three lines, one for check out, check in, and one for people who already checked in and their room wasn't ready and had to pick up keys. Thank god we chose the right one, because there was no signage explaining it.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money

reviews.text: We had four people (rooms) ahead of us in line when we got there and we waited over an hour and a half sweating our butts off in the very hot lobby before it was our turn to "start" our check in process. It was mind boggling how backwards and slow they did things. It took 45 minutes for them to complete our check in only to tell us they haven't cleaned our room yet. They said it would take 30 more minutes to clean the room and we asked them to just put us in a clean room, seems simple right, not quite, we were already assigned to "that" room and they couldn't change us. They said they had zero rooms they could put us in, I couldn't help but to ask why they didn't call at the beginning of our 45 minute check in to see if the room was clean. Clearly they weren't trained to think that far ahead. After another 15 minutes with the supervisor they finally backed down and gave us a clean room, they took a pen and crossed out our old room number with our new one on the check in folio, so hard.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The room: For being in the pyramid tower, their best room, it was ok at best. The bathroom was gross and smelled, the room was old and outdated.
reviews.title: WORST hotel

reviews.text: The staff: The staff overall was nice, the bar staff often ignored us for periods of time, eventhough we were tipping after every drink.
reviews.title: Grand Oasis Cancun Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Oasis and the Oasis Palm, I wanted to upgrade to the Grand Oasis this trip. I was disappointed that the room was in one of the Oasis buildings rather than the Grand. The room was totally white, with out any lamps or decorations. The furniture was just 2 small night stands and one was broken. We had other issues with the room, but they were fixed. Overall the room was "dumpy". The hotel itself is beautiful. The restaurants were crowded but having the option of just using the Grand Oasis restaurants made a big difference in waiting time. Everyone was helpful and friendly and did their best to make out stay perfect. I am not too picky about a room, but for the extra money I spent to stay at the Grand Oasis I was disappointed. After 3 times, now it is time to move on to another hotel.
reviews.title: 3rd time at the Oasis hotels

reviews.text: Room- plumbing broken 4 of 6 days. Smells of mildew, broken patio doors, not kid friendly balcony,sheets have spots,air condition not cold during the day.
reviews.title: Don't Book it. Grand Oasis is horrible in many ways.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants- long lines with no air condition, rude waiters,for some restaurants you have to make reservations at 7:00 am in order to get a reservation. You can only make the reservation the day prior. Short staffed long waits.
reviews.title: Happily Surprised

reviews.text: Pools-Water is not so clean, if you sway your arms you'll get hair clingy to you. No poolside waiters, only dos xx beer which is not cold in swim up bars or huts.
reviews.title: Slightly overrated

reviews.text: Lobby is hotter than heck. Most service personnel are rude especially information and check in check out service. Most waiters are rude. In this hotel the customer is never right.
reviews.title: Great place overall

description: The only all-inclusive entertainment resort in Cancun offering the best live shows, music festivals and daily performances, with surprises behind every smile - all included in the room rate. This resort is also know as the "Ultimate" resort in Cancun due to its incredible and expansive beach frontage, the largest pool and most beautiful landscaped areas in Cancun. Along with its rich and varied food and beverage program offering an unsurpassed 18 restaurants and 14 bars at the Grand Oasis Cancun.
